SHIELDS currently has 30 programs located in the communities of Compton and Watts with a static capacity of 3000 families.

page.normal_text:
Incorporated in 1991, SHIELDS has been working as a contractor with the Los Angeles County Department of Children and Family Services since 1992 as one of the first Family Preservation agencies in Los Angeles.
Incorporated in 1991, SHIELDS has I n c o r p o r a t e d

page.title:
In 1992, DCFS first initiated attempts to reduce their high rates of detentions and out-of-home placements with the implementation of Family Preservation Community Partnerships. Since then, they have implemented numerous programs and strategies in collaboration with the community to address these issues as well as the disproportionality evidenced in the child welfare system.

page.title:
How the Waiver Helped
How the Waiver Helped
page.normal_text:
Prior to the Waiver (2007-2008), efforts to address identified gaps in the child welfare system and to bring to scale pilot programs, such as Up Front Assessments, were not feasible due to the lack of flexible funding. Therefore, while many of the programs were successful, their full potential could not be realized until the Waiver allowed for the implementation of a full continuum of care throughout the County.
Prior to the Waiver (2007-2008), efforts to
address identified gaps in the child
welfare system and to bring to scale pilot
programs, such as Up Front
Assessments, were not feasible due to
the lack of flexible funding. Therefore,
while many of the programs were
successful, their full potential could not be
realized until the Waiver allowed for the
implementation of a full continuum of care
throughout the County.

page.title:
Up Front Assessments
Up Front Assessments
page.normal_text:
In 2004, DCFS began to pilot Point Engagement (POE). POE is a process that attempts to engage the family as soon as possible after referral to DCFS. It also represents a paradigm shift from a focus solely on child safety to looking at the family and their caretaking ability.
In 2004, DCFS began to pilot Point
Engagement (POE). POE is a process that
attempts to engage the family as soon as
possible after referral to DCFS. It also
represents a paradigm shift from a focus
solely on child safety to looking at the
family and their caretaking ability.

page.title:
Response Before POE
Response Before POE

SHIELDS began providing the Assessment Component of POE to the two offices who piloted the process: Wateridge (February) and Compton (June). Working with both offices, we developed a standard protocol for implementation:
